definition: warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: Full of tender feelings, she gazes at Xiao Wang, and says nothing.
sentences.chinese: 她一言不發，只是溫情脈脈地注視着小王。

sentences.english: Pinot Noir is one of those perplexing wines it is classy elegant and at times a little shy.
sentences.chinese: 加州紅葡萄酒是複雜的葡萄酒，優雅而溫情脈脈。

sentences.english: Harbor's tender friendship, the friendship between the breeze filled Zhengfan.
sentences.chinese: 友誼的港灣溫情脈脈，友誼的清風灌滿征帆。

sentences.english: He retained a tender affection for his wife to the end of his life.
sentences.chinese: 他一生自始至終都對他的妻子溫情脈脈。

sentences.english: The genial warmth of the sun around the door appeared somewhat human.
sentences.chinese: 門周圍溫暖柔和的陽光彷彿人一樣溫情脈脈。

sentences.english: To have this warm glow that comes from someone else's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 希望看到別人眼裏送來這溫情脈脈的一瞥。
